ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    Class containing all methods used to navigate EV3 about the board, uses an instance of LightLocalization class to incorporate odometry correction.
    Author:
    Mustafain, Bruno

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Navigation(LightLocalization lsLocalizer)
      Constructor for navigation class, creates a Navigation object.

      void navigateTunnel(double LL_X, double LL_Y, double UR_X, double UR_Y, java.lang.String team)
      Navigates the robot across a tunnel and stops either at (UR_X+1,(LL_Y+UR_Y)/2) if tunnel is parallel to origin x axis, or at ((LL_X+UR_X)/2, UR_Y + 1) if tunnel is parallel to y-axis.

    • Method Detail

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double theta)
        Calculates the minimum rotation angle needed to turn to target angle and turns the EV3 by that minimum angle. The rotation angle is calculated by subtracting the current odometer angle from theta and ensuring that the rotation angle is below 180 degrees. Uses NavigatorUtitlity to convert rotation angle to total rotation of each wheel and rotates each wheel by that amount.
        Parameters:
        theta - Target angle to turn to

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
                     double y,
                     int speed)
        Moves the robot to provided grid coordinate. Calculates the distance to move and the angle to turn to using the provided grid coordinates and the current odometer values. Keeps moving the robot until traveled distance is less than the calculated distance.
        Parameters:
        x - : x-coordinate of grid destination
        y - : y-coordinate of grid destination
        speed - : speed to use while traveling

      • navigateTunnel

        public void navigateTunnel(double LL_X,
                           double LL_Y,
                           double UR_X,
                           double UR_Y,
                           java.lang.String team)
        Navigates the robot across a tunnel and stops either at (UR_X+1,(LL_Y+UR_Y)/2) if tunnel is parallel to origin x axis, or at ((LL_X+UR_X)/2, UR_Y + 1) if tunnel is parallel to y-axis. Uses travelTo to position the robot perpendicular to the tunnel opening. Uses LightLocalization to ensure heading of robot enters tunnel at the correct heading. Uses travelTo to move in a straight line through the tunnel and move 1 tile after leaving the tunnel.
        Parameters:
        LL_X - the x coordinate of the lower left point of the tunnel
        LL_Y - the y coordinate of the lower left point of the tunnel
        UR_X - the x coordinate of the upper right point of the tunnel
        UR_Y - the y coordinate of the upper right point of the tunnel
        team - the team assigned to the ev3(red or green)
